29.21: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from youth, at length he will be even as his son.
29.22: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
29.23: The pride of a man shall bring him low: but the humble in spirit shall enjoy glory.
29.24: He that is partner with a thief, hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing and declareth it not.
29.25: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but he that trusteth in the Lord shall be exalted.
29.26: Many do seek the face of the ruler: but every man’s judgment cometh from the Lord.
29.27: A wicked man is abomination to the just, and he that is upright in his way, is abomination to the wicked.

30.1: The prophecy which the man spake unto Ithiel, even to Ithiel, and Ucal.
30.2: Surely I am more foolish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man in me.
30.3: For I have not learned wisdom, nor attained to the knowledge of holy things.
30.4: Who hath ascended up to heaven, and descended? Who hath gathered the wind in his fist? Who hath bound the waters in a garment? Who hath established all the ends of the world? What is his name, and what is his son’s name, if thou canst tell?
30.5: Every word of God is pure: he is a shield to those that trust in him.
30.6: Put nothing unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
30.7: Two things have I required of thee: deny me them not before I die.
30.8: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me not poverty, nor riches: feed me with food convenient for me,
30.9: Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is the Lord? or lest I be poor and steal, and take the Name of my God in vain.
30.10: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, when thou hast offended.
30.11: There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.
30.12: There is a generation that are pure in their own conceit, and yet are not washed from their filthiness.
30.13: There is a generation whose eyes are haughty, and their eye lids are lifted up.
30.14: There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their chaws as knives to eat up the afflicted out of the earth, and the poor from among men.
30.15: The horseleech hath two daughters which cry, Give, give. There be three things that will not be satisfied: yea, four that say not, It is enough.
30.16: The grave, and the barren womb, the earth, that cannot be satisfied with water, and the fire that saith not, It is enough.
30.17: The eye that mocketh his father and despiseth the instruction of his mother, let the ravens of the valley pick it out, and the young eagles eat it.
30.18: There be three things hid from me: yea, four that I know not:
30.19: The way of an eagle in the air, the way of a serpent upon a stone, the way of a ship in the midst of the sea, and the way of a man with a maid.
30.20: Such is the way also of an adulterous woman: she eateth and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have not committed iniquity.
30.21: For three things the earth is moved: yea, for four it cannot sustain itself.
30.22: For a servant when he reigneth, and a fool when he is filled with meat,
30.23: For the hateful woman, when she is married, and for a handmaid that is heir to her mistress.
30.24: These be four small things in the earth, yet they are wise, and full of wisdom.
30.25: The pismires a people not strong, yet prepare they their meat in summer:
30.26: The conies a people not mighty, yet make they their houses in the rock:
30.27: The grasshopper hath no king, yet go they forth all by bands:
30.28: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in king’s palaces.
30.29: There be three things that order well their going: yea, four are comely in going:
30.30: A lion which is strong among beasts, and turneth not at the sight of any:
30.31: A lusty greyhound, and a goat, and a king against whom there is no rising up.
30.32: If thou hast been foolish in lifting thyself up, and if thou hast thought wickedly, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.
30.33: When one churneth milk, he bringeth forth butter: and he that wringeth his nose, causeth blood to come out, so he that forceth wrath, bringeth forth strife.

31.1: THE WORDS OF KING LEMUEL: The prophecy which his mother taught him.
31.2: What my son! and what the son of my womb! and what, O son of my desires!
31.3: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways which is to destroy kings.
31.4: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine, nor for princes strong drink,
31.5: Lest he drink and forget the decree, and change the judgment of all the children of affliction.
31.6: Give ye strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto them that have grief of heart.
31.7: Let him drink, that he may forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.
31.8: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all the children of destruction.
31.9: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and judge the afflicted, and the poor.
31.10: Who shall find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above the pearls.
31.11: The heart of her husband trusteth in her, and he shall have no need of spoil.
31.12: She will do him good, and not evil all the days of her life.
31.13: She seeketh wool and flax, and laboreth cheerfully with her hands.
31.14: She is like the ships of merchants: she bringeth her food from afar.
31.15: And she ariseth, while it is yet night: and giveth the portion to her household, and the ordinary to her maids.
31.16: She considereth a field, and getteth it: and with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
31.17: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.
31.18: She feeleth that her merchandise is good: her candle is not put out by night.
31.19: She putteth her hands to the wheel, and her hands handle the spindle.
31.20: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor, and putteth forth her hands to the needy.
31.21: She feareth not the snow for her family: for all her family is clothed with scarlet.
31.22: She maketh herself carpets: fine linen and purple is her garment.
31.23: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth with the Elders of the land.
31.24: She maketh sheets, and selleth them, and giveth girdles unto the merchant.
31.25: Strength and honor is her clothing, and in the latter day she shall rejoice.
31.26: She openeth her mouth with wisdom, and the law of grace is in her tongue.
31.27: She overseeth the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
31.28: Her children rise up, and call her blessed: her husband also shall praise her, saying,
31.29: Many daughters have done virtuously: but thou surmountest them all.
31.30: Favor is deceitful, and beauty is vanity: but a woman that feareth the Lord she shall be praised.
31.31: Give her of the fruit of her hands, and let her own works praise her in the gates.
